superbowl

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • superbowl.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    charmainpedrigal

    Mathematical Methods

    The Utilities program finds the minimums, maximums and averages of certain Superbowl data. These would return integers which then can be accessed in other classes.

      Utilities()

    • Method Detail

      • findMinimumAttendance

        public static int findMinimumAttendance(java.util.ArrayList<Superbowl> events)
        This method is used to find the minimum amount of people who attended the Superbowl since the first event.
        Parameters:
        events - - This is the parameter used to loop through the arraylist. Each attendance is checked against each other to determine which is the minimum.
        Returns:
        - This return the integer that contains the minimum number of attendance.

      • findMaximumAttendance

        public static int findMaximumAttendance(java.util.ArrayList<Superbowl> events)
        This method is used to find the maximum amount of people who attended the Superbowl since the first event.
        Parameters:
        events - - This is the parameter used to loop through the arraylist. Each attendance is checked against each other to determine which is the maximum.
        Returns:
        - This return the integer that contains the maximum number of attendance.

      • findHighestScore

        public static int findHighestScore(java.util.ArrayList<Superbowl> events)
        This method is the same as finding the maximum attendance except this is for finding the highest score across all the events.
        Parameters:
        events - - This is the parameter used to loop through the arraylist. Each score is checked against each other to determine which is the maximum.
        Returns:
        - This return the integer that contains the maximum number of score.

      • findLowestScore

        public static int findLowestScore(java.util.ArrayList<Superbowl> events)
        This method is the same as finding the minimum attendance except this is for finding the lowest score across all the events.
        Parameters:
        events - - This is the parameter used to loop through the arraylist. Each score is checked against each other to determine which is the minimum.
        Returns:
        - This return the integer that contains the minimum number of score.

      • findAveragePointDif

        public static int findAveragePointDif(java.util.ArrayList<Superbowl> events)
        This method is used to fin the average point difference of all the games.
        Parameters:
        events - - This is the parameter used to loop through the arraylist. Each point difference of an event is added to the point difference of the next event until 2018. This is then divided by the number of events from the very first Superbowl event until 2018 to find out the average point difference.
        Returns:
        - This return the integer that contains the average point difference.
